body_html:
There are several ways to install from source. If you are using anaconda, then you should use https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#anaconda-install-path .

The "-j8" passed to the make command tells make to build in parallel using up to 8 threads. Whenever an error occurs on a thread, 'make' still waits for the other 7 threads to stop. So to actually find the error message you have to look further up in the output.

You seem to be mixing an Anaconda cuda package "/home/fangxi/anaconda3/lib/libnvrtc.so" with a system installed cuda package "/usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcufft.so" . This probably won't work. If you only plan on installing Caffe2 into the conda env then I'd recommend just uninstalling all conda-related packages in this conda env. Otherwise, try passing -DCUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda to scripts/build_anaconda.sh

You are also mixing system opencv with conda packages, which might cause problems due to its dependencies on other libraries. You should install opencv into your conda env or pass -DUSE_OPENCV=OFF to scripts/build_anaconda.sh

If those don't fix your errors, then post the cmake output (ctrl-f for "Summary") and the actual error that's stopping make.

The "-j8" passed to the make command tells make to build in parallel using up to 8 threads. Whenever an error occurs on a thread, 'make' still waits for the other 7 threads to stop. So to actually find the error message you have to look further up in the output. 

You seem to be mixing an Anaconda cuda package "/home/fangxi/anaconda3/lib/libnvrtc.so" with a system installed cuda package "/usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcufft.so" . This probably won't work. Otherwise, try passing -DCUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda to scripts/build_anaconda.sh 

You are also mixing system opencv with conda packages, which might cause problems due to its dependencies on other libraries. You should install opencv into your conda env or pass -DUSE_OPENCV=OFF to scripts/build_anaconda.sh
